*Answer:* The MNC whose Relative Performance Index is displayed via the green line is *Domino's Pizza, Inc.*


Domino's Pizza, Inc., branded as Domino's, is an American multinational pizza restaurant chain founded in 1960. The corporation is headquartered at the Domino's Farms Office Park in Ann Arbor, Michigan, and incorporated in Delaware. On May 12, 1983, Domino's opened its first international store, in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. By 1990, it had expanded to 1000 international locations.  

In February 2018, the chain became the largest pizza seller worldwide in terms of sales. The fourth quarter of 2019 marked the 104th consecutive quarter of international same store sales growth and the 35th consecutive quarter of U.S. same store sales growth for Domino's Pizza.

 Emphasis on technology innovation helped Domino's achieve more than half of all global retail sales in 2019 from digital channels, primarily online ordering and mobile applications. In the U.S., Domino's generates over 65% of sales via digital channels and has developed several innovative ordering platforms,
including those developed for Google Home, Facebook Messenger, Apple Watch, Amazon Echo and Twitter ‚Äì as well as Domino's Hotspots¬Æ, an
ordering platform featuring over 200,000 unique, non-traditional delivery locations. In June 2019, through an announced partnership with Nuro,
Domino's furthered its exploration and testing of autonomous pizza delivery. In late 2019, Domino's opened the Domino's Innovation Garage adjacent
to its headquarters in Ann Arbor, Michigan, to fuel continued technology and operational innovation ‚Äì while also launching its GPS technology, allowing
customers to follow the progress of the delivery driver from store to doorstep.

3/2/20, 13:17 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: _Banking malware_: *Raccoon banking malware threatens users of Chrome, Firefox and Edge*

This malware first discovered in 2019 is like Cerberus, a malware as a Service (MaaS). In other words, a malicious program whose users hire the services with a complete package, available from $200 per month. And this is one of the reasons to fear it right away: anyone can indeed use it for a fee.

The hackers who maintain it provide a protected hosting space for the control server, with an intuitive interface. But also technical support and regular updates. At this price, it is not the cheapest option for beginner pirates, but Cyberark researchers note that it is the simplest and most complete. Especially since this banking malware is more sophisticated than the other examples detected in nature. Raccoon can indeed exploit vulnerabilities in 35 browsers and 60 programs in total.

3/3/20, 13:16 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: _Technology_: *How to find the right zero trust strategy*

In 2019, Forrester reported that zero trust (ZT) would hit the mainstream in Europe. Security and risk professionals in international organisations with European operations need to understand how to apply zero trust.

Forrester has developed a zero-trust extended framework to guide chief information security officers (CISOs) with their zero-trust strategies.

Zero trust is a conceptual architectural model that uses microperimeters and microsegmentation to secure corporate networks. The approach increases data security through obfuscation techniques, limits the risks associated with excessive user privileges, and dramatically improves security detection and response through analytics and automation.

3/5/20, 13:15 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: _image recognition_ *A new AI chip can perform image recognition tasks in nanoseconds*

A new type of artificial eye, made by combining light-sensing electronics with a neural network on a single tiny chip, can make sense of what it‚Äôs seeing in just a few nanoseconds, far faster than existing image sensors.

*Why it matters*: Computer vision is integral to many applications of AI‚Äîfrom driverless cars to industrial robots to smart sensors that act as our eyes in remote locations‚Äîand machines have become very good at responding to what they see. But most image recognition needs a lot of computing power to work. Part of the problem is a bottleneck at the heart of traditional sensors, which capture a huge amount of visual data, regardless of whether or not it is useful for classifying an image. Crunching all that data slows things down

A sensor that captures and processes an image at the same time, without converting or passing around data, makes image recognition much faster using much less power. The design, published in Nature today by researchers at the Institute of Photonics in Vienna, Austria, mimics the way animals‚Äô eyes pre-process visual information before passing it on to the brain. _Read More_

Jack Welch was heralded by many as the greatest leader of his era. As CEO of General Electric from 1981 to 2001, he transformed it from a company known for appliances and lightbulbs to a multinational corporation that stretched into financial services and media as well as industrial products. He was initially criticized for cost-cutting and layoffs, which earned him the moniker ‚ÄúNeutron Jack,‚Äù but as GE‚Äôs revenues expanded and its share price soared in the ensuing years, he was lauded. In recent years, many have questioned his strategy, leadership style, and legacy. Was he too hard-nosed? Did his relentless push for growth, particularly at GE Capital, sow the seeds for the broader company‚Äôs later struggles? Was he really a CEO that others should emulate?

3/5/20, 19:25 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: _Board_ *Why the CEO Shouldn‚Äôt Also Be the Board Chair*

Beneath all the reporting on fatally flawed airplane design, serial ten-figure operating losses from big name startups, and Russian-linked presidential election information hackings, there lies an organizational leadership truth from the debacles at Boeing, WeWork, and Facebook: Be wary of giving the CEO job and the board chair job to one person.

As the complexity around and scrutiny of corporate leaders have intensified in recent years, proposals to abandon the Two Job ‚Äì One Person model have become the most common type of governance proposal submitted by shareholders. This is unsurprising. A board chair leads the board‚Äôs effort to excel at advising on strategy, monitoring performance, overseeing finance and controls, and evaluating management. A CEO establishes within the company a shared set of values, practices, and goals that enables the company to execute its strategic plan and build a meaningful future. To grow, a company needs both of these roles performed thoroughly and well.

*View 106*  Founder 
A quick update on the immediate operational impact due to Moratorium imposed on YES Bank: 
*NEFT* : No inward credits are coming from Yes Bank. Outward transactions going to Yes bank are also rejected at RBI. 
*RTGS* : settlement window was already over and hence no impact today . IFSC code is blocked at RBI so transaction may not happen tomorrow.
*CTS*: NPCI has kept a hold on the clearing files. They have informed that all the cheque draw an on YES bank, sent by the collecting banks for clearing is being cancelled in the clearing file. They are going to share a file which will be net of YES bank records. Collecting banks will have to treat all the yes banks cheque as returned. This would also mean that in inward clearing we shall not receive any cheque‚Äôs from yes bank. 
IMPS/UPI: NPCI has already blocked transactions from yes bank.
*ATM* : NFS network is blocked for yes bank cards, I.e. no transactions on other bank ATM for yes bank card holders.
*NACH* : Npci has unwinded the batches and have kept the settlement on hold for today‚Äôs last 2 batches. They are going to give combined settlement tomorrow morning

*Financial Stability Report*

This report reviews conditions affecting the stability of the financial system by analyzing vulner abilities related to valuation pressures, borrowing by businesses and households, financial leverage, and funding risk. It also highlights several near-term risks that, if realized, could interact with such vulnerabilities. Investor appetite for risk generally appears to have returned to a level in the middle of its historical range but remains elevated for some important classes of assets. Debt loads of businesses are historically high. The core of the financial sector appears resilient, with leverage low and funding risk limited relative to the levels of recent decades.¬† ¬†

3/6/20, 18:11 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: *FINAL ANSWER TO FIAKS QUEST 65*

*No.1*
Answer: *I am Generation Equality: Realizing Women's Rights*

The IWD 2020 campaign theme is drawn from a notion 'Collective Individualism'. Collectively, we can make change happen. Collectively, we can each help to create a gender equal world. We can all choose to be #EachforEqual.

*No. 2*
Answer: *Finland*

New zealand was the first self governing nation to grant women the right to vote in 1893. Finland came in second granting the right in 1906. Also Finland was the first country in the world to elect a woman to office in 1907.

*No.3*
Answer: *Better Pay and Voting Rights*

The roots can be traced to 1908, when 15000 women marched through New York City demanding voting rights, better pay and shorter working hours. A year later, the first National Woman's Day was observed in the US on February 28.

*No. 4*
Answer: *19 November*
International Men's Day is celebrated in over 80 countries on 19 November. Additionally, the month of november is also occasionally recognized as International Men's Month.


*Some facts you didn't know about*

‚Ä¢Before International Women's Day, the first National Woman's day was observed on February 28, 1908 in the US

 ‚Ä¢ The first International Women's day event wasn't even held until 1911, and only then in Austria, Denmark, Germany, and Switzerland.

‚Ä¢ The entire month of March is "Women's History Month" in the United States

‚Ä¢International Women's Day is celebrated as official holiday in 27 countries around the world

‚Ä¢In 1975, the United Nations gave official sanction to International Women's Day

‚Ä¢Bread and Roses was another famous campaign that took place in the year the International Women's day was observed first

‚Ä¢IWD is symbolically celebrated with colors of purple, green and white.

3/6/20, 21:55 - Fintech Shirisha ghosh Torit NnR: *RBI announces revival scheme for Yes Bank : 10 Key points are :-*

1) Authorised capital shall stand altered to ‚Çπ5,000 crore and number of equity shares will stand altered to¬†‚Çπ2400 crore of¬†‚Çπ2 each.

2) The investor bank shall agree to invest in the equity of reconstructed Yes Bank to the extent that post infusion it holds 49% shareholding in the reconstructed bank at a price not less than‚Çπ10 (face value of¬†‚Çπ2) and premium of¬†‚Çπ8.

3) The investor bank shall not reduce its holding below 26% before completion of three years from the date of infusion of the capital into Yes Bank.

4) From the appointed date, the office of the administrator of Yes Bank, appointed by the Reserve Bank, shall stand vacated, and a new board will be constituted.

5) The investor bank shall have two nominee directors appointed on the board of the reconstructed Yes Bank.

6) RBI may appoint additional directors on the board of Yes Bank. It will be open to the board of directors of Yes Bank to co-opt more directors.

7) All the employees of reconstructed Yes Bank shall continue in its service with the same remuneration and on the same terms and conditions of service (T&C), including terms of determination of service and retirement, as were applicable to such employees immediately before the appointed date, at least for a period of one year.

8) The board of directors of reconstructed Yes Bank will however, have the freedom to discontinue the services of the key managerial personnel (KMPs) at any point of time after following due procedure.

9) The offices and branches of reconstructed Yes Bank bank shall continue to function in the same manner and at the same places they were functioning prior to the effective date, without in any way being affected by this scheme.

10) RBI said it will be open to the reconstructed Yes Bank to open new offices and branches or close down existing offices or branches, in accordance with the extant policy of the central bank.

3/9/20, 16:24 - Vikas Business Phone: *FIAKS community member shared this PR in the media appreciating great role played by NPCI, RBI to get Phone Pe/ Bharat Pe service up*

Media report say 

ICICI Bank assembled a multifunctional 40-member team to immediately step in and ensure customer disruptions could be minimised. People from different departments like legal, account opening, technology, business banking and others were part of the team in order to ensure decision making and execution was prompt. 

ICICI Bank had to establish multiple features and services such as creating nodal accounts, reconciliation systems, processing capacities in the back end to be able to support transactions through PhonePe. Its officials worked very closely with the PhonePe team on getting the services up and running quickly.

PhonePe had been in discussions with ICICI Bank for months *after NPCI mandated a multiparty model for all UPI third party applications*. Even BharatPe was processing some part of its daily volume through ICICI Bank. But, Yes Bank was still their major processor.

ICICI Bank officials also pointed out to the *important role played by NPCI in the migration of services*. As a settlement platform, NPCI now has to route transactions originating from Yes Bank handles into ICICI Bank systems

As of now with permission from NPCI and RBI, all @YBL transactions are being driven to ICICI Bank. They will soon release an additional handle with ICICI Bank as well.Once Yes Bank moratorium is over, it will mean PhonePe users will have a choice of two handles from two different banks to work with. 

Also PhonePe shifted its nodal accounts to ICICI Bank to ensure that its merchants receive the funds on time and the confidence in the system is not hurt. 

The agility shown by PhonePe and ICICI Bank with *the right support provided by the NPCI can be a great case study.*

Management guru Peter Drucker believed the proper ratio between a chief executive‚Äôs pay and that of the average worker should be around *20-to-1* as it was in 1965. ‚ñ™123-to-1; in 1989, 
‚ñ™it was 59-to-1; in 1978, 
‚ñ™it was 30-to-1; and in 1965, ‚ñ™it was, as Drucker‚Äôs ratio would have it, 20-to-1.

3/11/20, 11:42 - Vikas Business Phone: _FIAKS community CXO of Leading bank in gulf shared this update_  on *Understanding Oil*

‚ñ™Ô∏èUS shale producers have added a huge surplus into the global oil market , making the US a net oil exporter . OPEC+ Russia were trying to keep supplies constrained to keep prices up. They tried to bankrupt the US producers in 2014 but failed .

‚ñ™Ô∏èLast week there was no agreement on further cuts . This seems to be a decision made to push the over leveraged US shale producers to bankruptcy by unleashing a supply glut in a falling demand environment . The consequences are complex .

‚ñ™Ô∏èA large portion of the US junk bonds market is funding US shale producers . At USD 55 levels they were profitable . At USD 35 levels it will be difficult . The Saudi and Russian aim is to cripple this supply and then raise rates once bankruptcies have removed some of this .

‚ñ™Ô∏èThis was tried in 2014 and did not work . In 2020 given the demand pressures , the amount of debt and the size of the US shale production , this oil price war will hurt if prices stay below USD 50 to 60 range

‚ñ™Ô∏èThe Russians have built financial reserves over the last 6 years and can withstand the huge fiscal deficit that low oil prices and continued economic sanctions will lead to . They claim they can hold out for multiple years.  Not so sure .

‚ñ™Ô∏èSaudis will face larger fiscal deficits in selling oil so cheap . The show case Aramco listing is already trading below the IPO price . The Saudi govt will need to borrow and spend more and keep the growth initiatives going domestically . Funding becomes a question mark

‚ñ™Ô∏èOther OPEC producers will see a knock on impact of lower prices . Real estate in the Middle East will be the first victim . Recipients of aid from the Middle East as well as the value chains supplying goods to them will suffer 

‚ñ™Ô∏èNon oil producing countries will see their oil import bills lowered dramatically if oil sustains at the USD 35 levels for a few months . Consumers will benefit and central banks will have monetary space to cut rates as deflation gets imported in

‚ñ™Ô∏èBut the destruction in aggregate global demand is what is spooking the markets . Given integrated value chains, demand destruction will outweigh the positive impact of lower oil prices globally

‚ñ™Ô∏èAdd on Coronavirus uncertainty , a US election year , already weak European ,Japanese , Chinese economies and we have a major global risk off . On its 11 th anniversary the Global Bull market is teetering on the brink of ceding ground to the bears

‚ñ™Ô∏èThe usual monetary stimulus is still on the table but seems to have diminishing marginal utility . Fiscal steps will be needed to reinflate and reflate the global economy . Those resources are limited

‚ñ™Ô∏èAdd in the geopolitical issues and we have convergent , global, large scale risks . The need is for a fresh concerted , convergent and united action by the G7 and G20 leadership

‚ñ™Ô∏èStatesmanship is rare at present in the anti globalisation, ‚Äúmy country first‚Äùenvironment . The market forces will take time to sort this out and the cost will be painful . ‚ÄúRIP Good Times‚Äùas a PE fund wrote in 2008 before the GFC tsunami . We have to move fast,unitedly
3/11/20, 13:14 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: _Cyber Security_: *Stop saying employees are the weakest link in cybersecurity*

What‚Äôs wrong with believing employees are the weak point?‚Äù, you might ask. Given the ever-increasing frequency data breaches ‚Äì with human error often being either a cause or catalyst in the majority of cases ‚Äì you‚Äôd be forgiven for thinking that employees are naturally at fault.

But they‚Äôre not ‚Äì and there are a few logical reasons why.

The weakest link?
Firstly, framing the conversation like this doesn‚Äôt get us anywhere. Are football players to blame when they lose a match? Well, in a way, but the players are also to ‚Äòblame‚Äô when they win. And even when they do lose, telling them that they‚Äôre the problem is only going to demoralize and lead to further losses.

Secondly, if blame has to lie somewhere, it surely lies with the security awareness programs rather than the employees who rely on those programs to better protect themselves. The reason that human-error breaches continue to occur at such at rate is that ‚Äì and let‚Äôs be honest here ‚Äì security awareness training in its current form just doesn‚Äôt work.

3/11/20, 18:08 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: _Business_: *How to Work With Someone Who‚Äôs Disengaged*

If you love your job, consider yourself lucky. According to global estimates, just 13% of people are engaged at work, which contributes to a huge productivity loss. In the United States alone, disengagement costs the economy around $500 billion every year (that is roughly the size of the global beer industry). These estimates are based on a simple calculation, namely scaling the average differences in productivity between engaged and disengaged workers.

Engagement can be interpreted as a broad indicator of how motivated an employee is at work. This means low engagement levels can be expected to play a significant role in driving the massive loss in productivity we are seeing worldwide. Employee performance is as much the result of a person‚Äôs motivation as it of their talent or ability. But while companies are relatively good at hiring for talent, especially when talent can be equated to hard skills or past experience, they are generally less apt at hiring for soft skills, including motivational traits.  A candidate could seem to have high potential on paper or during an interview but fail to live up to it on the job.

3/17/20, 17:14 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: *Millennials Don‚Äôt Change Jobs As Often As You Think*

In general, workers are job-hopping less often today than they were 30-plus years ago. A recent NBER working paper by Raven Molloy, Christopher Smith, and Abigail K. Wozniak shows that the share of workers with less than one year of tenure fell from 18-20% in the 1980s and 1990s to about 16% in recent years. At the same time, the share of workers with more than 20 years of tenure has increased from 8-9% in the 1980s and 1990s to about 10% in recent years.

The second key reason for why employees are perceived as switching jobs more frequently is the generational narrative, branding millennials as the job hopping generation. A number of recent studies and surveys refute this view, but perception can take a long time to change.

3/17/20, 17:44 - Vikas Business Phone: _FIAKS Report Aggregation Initiative(FRAI) 161_

*Streamlining customer verification for regulatory compliance*

Regulatory measures have been put in place across the financial services industry to tackle fraud. *What is bank transfer fraud?*

As remote work becomes the norm for employees and companies, an important discussion that‚Äôs taking place in IT organizations is the discussion around cybersecurity.

You can use this opportunity to increase cybersecurity awareness across your organization.

One of the core principles in cybersecurity that‚Äôs taking shape these days is around zero trust. That‚Äôs how companies can provide a much higher level of security and if done right, can provide a much better user experience.

The ‚Äã*Zero Trust* ‚Äãtenet means that from the start, every action is not trusted. In a Zero Trust model, in addition to authentication. there‚Äôs constant monitoring to ensure abnormal or risky behavior is identified immediately and remediation steps can be taken. Monitoring includes how users interact with an application, from what network, from what device, during what time of day and other variables. Using artificial intelligence and machine learning, a behavioral profile can be built for each user. It‚Äôs important to monitor that so that you can identify unusual circumstances and the only way to effectively do that is with artificial intelligence so that remediation can happen at the speed of computers.

3/20/20, 11:14 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: *The dollar is in high demand, prone to dangerous appreciation*

The world now faces the opposite problem: a dollar in high demand, prone to dangerous appreciation. It has, unsurprisingly, strengthened against the currencies of emerging markets, which have suffered brutal capital outflows since late January (see chart). But the dollar has, more surprisingly, also strengthened against safe-haven currencies such as the yen and the Swiss franc, and pushed currencies like the pound and the Norwegian krone to their weakest level in decades. On March 18th Bloomberg‚Äôs dollar spot index, which measures the greenback against a basket of currencies, hit an all-time high, its seventh consecutive rise. Anyone seeking to swap their yen, francs or euros for dollars (and then swap them back again after a few months) must pay a premium, known as the cross-currency basis, which is deducted from any interest they earn. That premium has risen sharply on several occasions in the past two weeks.

3/24/20, 11:25 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: _FIAKS BESPOKE_ *Why Should An EMV Card Have Magnetic Stripe At All?*

Well, the issue is not EMV implementation on the acquiring side. It is a non-EMV implementation on the issuing side.Card cloning is very easy for any Magnetic Swipe card and very difficult for EMV Chip card. Current ATM card cloning are all examples of MagStripe card cloning as banks have not fully phased out MagStripe card to EMV Chip card.
https://bit.ly/3biyCX6

3/24/20, 12:05 - +1 (916) 837-0472: Retaining the mag Stripe was purely for fallback (or backward compatibility) purpose at a time when many PoS and ATM readers were not yet chip ready/certified. With acceptance infrastructure updated with chip read capabilities today, there is no need to have a real mag Stripe on the card anymore. The same mag Stripe data is in any case encoded on the chip as well. Hope this helps.

3/24/20, 13:24 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: _Chinese Virus Crisis_ *The Coronavirus Crisis doesn't have to lead to layoffs*

Leaders are obligated to make responsible decisions to keep their companies afloat. But those who manage the economic effects of this crisis in a clear and compassionate way create more value for their companies and will come out of this pandemic stronger than ever before.

Consider decelerating pay decreases for lower salary ranges to protect employees who are the most vulnerable. For example, you might reduce salaries of your highest paid employees by 10%, mid-range salaried employees by 5%, and everyone else above a certain threshold by half of that. This is what was done at BIDMC during its cost-reduction‚Äîand employees appreciated that senior leaders tried all sorts of creative approaches to minimize head-count reduction.

https://bit.ly/39grf0M
3/24/20, 15:50 - Amex Varun Sakhuja IIR: *Summary of FMs address to media on relief on Statutory compliances due to Covid 19 on 24.03.2020*

Income tax related:
1. FY 2018-19 / AY 2019-20 ITR due date extended to 30.6.2020 for ITRs not filed since far. Interest rate reduced to 9% from 12%
2. No extension for Tds but for delayed deposit of Tds interest @ 9% instead of 18% upto June 2020
3. Dates of notice issue/ intimation/ sanction/ appeal filing/ return filing/ reports/ any other documents, investment in tax saving instruments/ any compliance under income tax or related acts extended to 30th June, 2020
4. Aadhar pan linking date to be extended to 30th June
5. VSV scheme due date extended to 30th June. No additional interest due post March 2020.

GST related:
1. Last date for filing March, April & May 2020 gst returns including compensation laws extended to end of June based on original due date of filing
2. For Companies having less than 5 crores turnover not to pay any late filing fee, interest or penalty will be charged.
3. For Companies having turnover more tha. 5 crores, late fee or penalty not to be charged. Interest @ 9% to apply.
4. Date of opting composition scheme extended to 30.6.2020

Custom & central tax related:
1. Sabka Vishwas scheme due date extended from March 2020 to June 2020. No interest for payment made upto June 2020.
2. Custom clearance upto 30.6.2020 will work as normal 24X7

MCA/ ROC related
1. MCA 21 registry - moratorium issued wef 1.4.2020 upto 30.9.2020. There shall not be any addition fee for late filing
2. Board meetings relaxed for a period of 60 days till next two quarters
3. Applicability of Caro 2020 deferred by one year to be applicable from 2020-21 and not 2019-20
4. For the year 2019-20, relaxation given for non- holding of independent directors meeting
5. For newly incorporated companies to be given additional time of 6 months to file declaration of commencement of business
6. Any director who does not comply with minimum residency requirement, shall not be treated as a violation
7. Requirement to create deposit reserve may now be met upto June 2020
8. Deadline for Requirement to invest 15% debentures maturing during a FY extended to June 2020

IBC related matters
1. Threshold for default increased from 1 lakhs to 1 crores to avoid triggering of IBC against MSMEs.
2. If situation continues beyond April, the government may consider suspending section 7, 9 & 10 of IBC

Fisheries compliances:
1. Compliances related to import permits (SIPs) which were due to expire by 15.4.2020 extended by 3 months
2. Delay upto 1 month in arrival of imports shall be condoned

Bank related compliances:
1. Debit card holders who withdraw cash from any bank ATM to pay any additional charges
2. Minimum balance fee waived
3. Reduce Bank charges for digital trade transactions for all trade finance consumers

Commerce related:
1. Principle to be followed: Extention of timelines from procedural & eligibility point of view. But there shall be no extension of scheme guidelines.

3/24/20, 16:19 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: _Managing people_ *Rethink your relationship with your vendors*

The problem with current company-vendor relations starts at the beginning of the relationship. Companies go through long, expensive vetting processes for vendors, often spending months and significant resources to ensure they select the best bidder. Then, instead of welcoming them with open arms, they negotiate hard on pricing, delay payments, and generally squeeze them in any possible way to get the best possible terms. Despite all the effort that went into the selection process, companies often view vendors as ‚Äúeasily replaceable‚Äù and keep an arm's length relationship.

Neither organizations nor service providers benefit when the wrong approach is employed. Organizations should take the lead in treating their vendors and gig workers like strategic partners and employees.

https://bit.ly/2UcGIuA

3/24/20, 19:39 - Vikas Business Phone: *FIAKS community Thought Leader on Importance of  Nearby GROCERIES SHOP & CASH SAYS*

*View 34* founder 

While I never cared online discounts, due to lack of attention in most of the online purchase scenarios, I am now taking a second, to see if there is any discount with specific payment instruments, in recent times, so I can avail some discount, when buying mobile phones etc on flipkart.com/amazon.in.

All this, when things are good, and we are cool, going to office and enjoying over weekends, but I am sure, this will not be the case with many, specifically in these times of Epidemic Covid-19.

Recently, after increase in awareness w.r.t. Covid-19, and after few of the suppliers (who are selling sanitizers) rejected delivering Sanitizers to my pincode in Hyderabad (through amazon/flipkart), I went around medical shops to get my supplies, that reminded me once again, to double ensure purchasing through nearby stores in regular times.

it's is these small medical shops around, that we might have occasionally ignored, are coming to our rescue in current time. 

How much innovative these online marketplaces becomes, and how much they expand their customer base, which is undeniable, a balance of sources has to be maintained, for the Supply chain to sustain, and to be able to fulfill the demand of people who span from Cities to Villages

While I always used to think of how people might transact in a 100% digitized Country, 2004 Tsunami is an eye opener (when we stayed in Kakinada, Andhra Pradesh, a Coastal Town then), and when I thought to expect 80% to 90% Digitization with 10% to 20% Cash possibility, to handle Natural Calamities/Epidemics etc, despite possible options like Barter System etc, that worked centuries earlier, and may not be a better option, in this financial note centric transaction ecosystem (physical/digital)

3/24/20, 20:07 - EKO Anupam Varghese NnC: I was stuck in Kerala during the 2018 floods. Most calamities are crippling. But there are some, like the floods, where both electricity and network connectivity get blanked out.

The silver lining to this covid episode is that power and connectivity have mostly survived, so far. (Thank God for all those who are working for this behind the scenes). So, unless stopped by law/ security, e/m comm continues to provide great convenience.

But, when all else fails, the humble cash in the wallet and the old store next door only will stand a chance.

We don't yet have the level of resilience, redundancy and reliability in electricity, network and logistics that would make centralized tech heavy solutions dependable enough in times like these.

3/26/20, 11:34 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: _Future of banking_  *Banking in 2030*

Banks have been facing a crisis of confidence since the financial and economic crash of 2008, says KPMG‚Äôs Peter Rothwell. New technology and changing customer demands mean that, by 2030, that crisis could become existential. Will we need banks in the future‚Äîor just their services?

In the next ten years, he says, banks of all sizes will have to accept that usability, reliability, trust and customer service will be the key differentiators in the sector. Trustworthiness may be harder to earn in a world of apps and platforms devoid of imposing high-street buildings and centuries-old brands, but a new generation of users will expect to see a greater transparency and commitment to cyber security than many banks demonstrate at the moment.

3/30/20, 23:43 - Fintech Easy2lend Riaz Maniyar NnR: *Clarification on Income tax related issues*:


1) FY 2019-20 is not at all extended till 30th June, only the date is extended for some compliances.

2) Belated returns or Revised returns for the FY 2018-19 can be filed till 30th June.

3) In the FY 2019-20, income is taxable till 31st March only and not upto 30th June, i.e. for taxability of income financial year is considered till 31st March only.

4) Deductions under 80C, 80D, etc. can be claimed by investing till 30th June.

5) New LIC, mediclaim, PPF, NPS, etc. policies taken till 30th June will be eligible for the deduction for the FY 2019-20.

6) Payment of Premium of old policies of LIC, mediclaim, PPF, NPS, etc. due upto 31st March can be claimed as deduction even if paid till 30th June.

7) Housing loan interest is eligible for deduction on accrual basis, so interest accrued till 31st March will be eligible for the deduction in FY 2019-20. However Installments due upto 31st March can be claimed as deduction even if paid till 30th June.

*$20 TRILLION LAWSUIT AGAINST CHINA FOR RELEASING A BIOLOGICAL WEAPON OF MASS DESTRUCTION CALLED COVID 19* 

*US group says coronavirus is bioweapon*

 A $20 trillion lawsuit has been filed against Chinese authorities in the US over coronavirus outbreak. American lawyer Larry Klayman and his advocacy group Freedom Watch along with Texas company Buzz Photos have filed the lawsuit against the Chinese government, Chinese army, the Wuhan Institute of Virology, Director of Wuhan Institute of Virology Shi Zhengli and Chinese army's Major General Chen Wei.

The plaintiffs have sought $20 trillion, which is a bigger amount than China's GDP, claiming coronavirus is the result of a biological weapon prepared by the Chinese authorities.

They have accused China of aiding and abetting death, provision of material support to terrorists, conspiracy to cause injury and death of US citizens, negligence, wrongful death, and assault and battery.

They allege the virus had released from the Wuhan Virology Institute. The plaintiffs stated that the COVID-19 virus was "designed" by China to kill mass populations. Biological weapons were outlawed in 1925 and hence such a biological weapon is a terrorist-related weapon of mass destruction, the lawsuit mentioned.

The American group cites multiple media reports that said that there was only one microbiology lab in China that handled advanced viruses like the novel coronavirus -- in Wuhan. To cover up, the plaintiffs alleged, China linked statements on coronavirus with national security protocols.

Klayman and the plaintiffs also alleged that Chinese doctors and researchers who spoke out about coronavirus and "raised the alarm to the outside world internationally" have been "silenced". They added that such was the desperation of Major General Chen to save herself from the virus that she injected herself and six members of her team with a potential vaccine that was yet to be tested.

They also alleged that all the defendants were working together to perpetuate "international terrorism".

The lawsuit stated that while coronavirus is slow-acting and slow-spreading to be used against a country's military, "it was designed to be used against the general population of one or more of China's perceived enemy nations, such as the United States."

The American plaintiffs also asked for a jury trial against the Chinese defendants.

4/1/20, 17:16 - Vikas Business Phone: *Why RBL And Indusind May Not Be The Next Yes Bank*

As of Dec 31st 2019, bank has investment of Rs 19,100 Cr of which high-quality liquid assets stood at Rs 16,300 Cr. The bank has also maintained Tier 1 Capital of Rs 10,200 Crs.

According to Sep-2019 results RBL has a balance with RBI to the tune of Rs 3,600 Crs. Also it has Rs 2,800 Cr as balance with the bank for money at short notice. The number might have slightly deviated by now, but on a baseline, it would have still maintained roughly Rs 5,000 Cr as cash in hand and balances with RBI.

All in all, RBL has liquidity of roughly Rs 33,000 Cr. It needs another 30,000 Cr to cover depositors‚Äô money. For that, it can (easily) sell its Rs 59,635 Cr loan book at a discount of 50% and get the Rs 30,000 Cr for immediate disbursal.

RBL augmented its Tier 1 capital by raising Rs 2,025 Cr via QIP at Rs 351 per share in Dec 2019. In the same quarter RBL raise another Rs 675 Cr via QIP by offering shares at Rs 340 per piece. All in all, RBL Bank looks healthy.

4/2/20, 12:49 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: _FIAKS Bepoke_: *Religion Column in KYC: Why Is It An Issue?*

To hide behind Western standards of propriety and exclude this critical data point from bank records seem foolish. Like any non-core data, the individual concerned should have the option not to provide the data if he so chooses, but banks asking for it per se should not be frowned upon.

It can help the banks decide at what time banks should pitch for a personal loan to a customer like for Diwali or during Christmas; whether they should offer interest-bearing products or profit-sharing products etc.

Of course, there have to be strict rules to ensure the information is not used to discriminate or favor any particular group or community, but the idea that we can prevent discrimination by suppressing information is flawed.

4/3/20, 18:05 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: *FINAL ANSWER TO FIAKS QUEST 69*

*Q1*  *The Defense Production Act*

The Defense Production Act permits the federal government to impose some control over private industry to ensure the production of material that is deemed necessary for national defense. Here‚Äôs an explanation of the law.

President Trump had avoided using the full force of the law, opting instead to push the private sector to voluntarily address a shortage of critical medical equipment, particularly ventilators.

But later on, he authorized the government to ‚Äúuse any and all authority available under the Defense Production Act‚Äù to commandeer General Motors‚Äô factories and supply chains to produce ventilators.


*Q2*  *Israel*

After effectively shutting down Israel‚Äôs court system in March, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu authorized the country‚Äôs internal security agency to tap into a previously undisclosed trove of cellphone data to retrace the movements of people who have contracted the coronavirus and identify others who should be quarantined because their paths crossed.


*Q3*   *Peace Corps*

The Peace Corps in the month of March evacuated more than 7,000 volunteers from posts in more than 60 countries, in an effort to prevent them from becoming stranded during the pandemic.

The group, an independent agency of the U.S. government created by President John F. Kennedy in 1961, sends volunteers abroad to help with social and economic development projects.

4/9/20, 10:33 - +91 90046 19987: Kindly find below the Summary of call with *Mr. P K Basu, Economist, Consultant & Adjunct Professor at ESSEC Asia Pacific Business School, Singapore* hosted by I-Sec Insititutional Equities Team.

*Executive summary:*

*India may come out much stronger relative to expectations once we are through this uncertain period*.
Fundamentals of India have improved basis: 
a) Corporate tax cut and probably lowest taxes wrt new manufacturing units 
b) Reluctance of global and US markets to significantly depend on Chinese exports may lead to shift in global supply chain providing opportunities to India. 
c) India is relatively under-levered relative to world (refer point 1) 
d) Higher export growth in electronics relative to imports during last few years (indicate import substitution is gaining ground), 
e) Substantially lower oil prices (provides automatic stimulus of 1.5% to 2% of GDP) 
f)  Real rates are relative higher with respect to rest of the world providing RBI levers to cut rates further (Global Central Banks have exhausted ammunition to reduce rates further). 


*For details refer below pointer:*

1) Credit growth in UPA 1&2 averaged ~26%. But in last 6 years India has been able to reigned in. Therefore, in last 6 years *while world has been leveraging up India is relatively under-leveraged*. Sovereign bond issue / opening of domestic bond market can help India lever up.

2) In terms of goods exports alone India has gained market share in US (this has accelerated during last two years). Labour market reform making significant progress, Incentives for Electronics additionally rolled out in March, Attractive corporate tax rate for new investment in manufacturing rolled out in Sep-19 should induce substantial amount of investments into shifting of global value chains into India.

China: growth to be lower may even witness a negative growth as there are significant un-utilized capacity. Also, both *global and US markets acceptance to China exports dependency expected to reduce* once we normalize after this crisis.This may bring financial issues in China to resurface.This should too open up opportunity to India. 

3) There is a *justifiable restraint on part of government in rolling out of fiscal package* relative to size what US and some other countries have rolled out. However, when you look at India's public debt to GDP relative to world, India stands better. Therefore, one need not worry on the fiscal and public debt is getting out of control because of loss of revenue due to lockdown. Also, if any of the strategic sale takes place, Oil bounty due to drop in prices (itself is 1.5% to 2% of GDP) and staggered opening up of the economy which has been planned (assuming situation comes under control by end April) should ensure recovery in fiscal coming back. US fiscal stimulus is 10%-11% of GDP. However, US is starting with a 105% of public debt GDP. India's central government debt is restrained around 47% of GDP and all public debt is not more than 60% of GDP.   

4) India is a big importer in electronics and fuel. Interesting difference is *export growth in electronics is higher than import growth* (albiet on a lower base). While Electronics export growth ranged about 35% to 45% a year for last 3 years (commands only 4.5% share in total exports); Imports are declining at 6% to 10% a year (Electronics export are now 35% of imports from being 25%, 2 years earlier). This indicates successful substitution of domestic production for imports.

Oil the benefit is from structurally lower prices. This shall help restrain inflation, which ensures policy rates to trend down. 
This makes India stand out relative to world because other Central Banks have exhausted ammunition to reduce rates further (while they can extend QE). *Real rates in India are relatively higher* wrt world if one were to take WPI inflation to policy rate. Of course there was a spurt in food prices during last 6 months, may be COVID is a blessing to reduce food prices enabling RBI to cut rates further.  
Hide quoted text

5) *Current account position:* CAD in last reported quarter was 0.2% of GDP and in Q4 FY20 there may be a small surplus given sharp decline in oil prices in March. 

6) *INR:* may see stabilization and then strengthening a bit once we are through these uncertain times. Given CAD position is strong and capital will flow back into place like India. 
In the near term, there might be some strengthening of USD. (Expect average USD:INR at 74 for rest of the year)

*Therefore, once recovery begins India shall be big beneficiary.*

4/10/20, 14:21 - Vikas Business Phone: *FIAKS community member shared an interesting read on - UNHACKABLE INTERNET*

An internet based on quantum physics will soon enable inherently secure communication. A team led by Stephanie Wehner, at Delft University of Technology, is building a network connecting four cities in the Netherlands entirely by means of quantum technology. Messages sent over this network will be unhackable.

In the last few years, scientists have learned to transmit pairs of photons across fiber-optic cables in a way that absolutely protects the information encoded in them. A team in China used a form of the technology to construct a 2,000-kilometer network backbone between Beijing and Shanghai‚Äîbut that project relies partly on classical components that periodically break the quantum link before establishing a new one, introducing the risk of hacking.

The Delft network, in contrast, will be the first to transmit information between cities using quantum techniques from end to end.

The technology relies on a quantum behavior of atomic particles called entanglement. Entangled photons can‚Äôt be covertly read without disrupting their content.

But entangled particles are difficult to create, and harder still to transmit over long distances. Wehner‚Äôs team has demonstrated it can send them more than 1.5 kilometers (0.93 miles), and they are confident they can set up a quantum link between Delft and the Hague by around the end of this year. Ensuring an unbroken connection over greater distances will require quantum repeaters that extend the network.

Such repeaters are currently in design at Delft and elsewhere. The first should be completed in the next five to six years, says Wehner, with a global quantum network following by the end of the decade.

4/13/20, 19:11 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: *FIAKS community member shared info on ‚ÄúHYPER-PERSONALIZED MEDICINE‚Äù*

_Genetic medicine tailored to a single patient means hope for people whose ailments were previously uncurable_.


Here‚Äôs a definition of a hopeless case: a child with a fatal disease so exceedingly rare that not only is there no treatment, there‚Äôs not even anyone in a lab coat studying it. *‚ÄúToo rare to care,‚Äù goes the saying.*

*That‚Äôs about to change, thanks to new classes of drugs that can be tailored to a person‚Äôs genes*. If an extremely rare disease is caused by a specific DNA mistake‚Äîas several thousand are‚Äîthere‚Äôs now at least a fighting chance for a genetic fix.

One such case is that of Mila Makovec, a little girl suffering from a devastating illness caused by a unique genetic mutation, who got a drug manufactured just for her. Her case made the New England Journal of Medicine in October, after doctors moved from a readout of her genetic error to a treatment in just a year. They called the drug milasen, after her.

The treatment hasn‚Äôt cured Mila. But it seems to have stabilized her condition: it has reduced her seizures, and she has begun to stand and walk with assistance.

Mila‚Äôs treatment was possible because creating a gene medicine has never been faster or had a better chance of working. The new medicines might take the form of gene replacement, gene editing, or antisense (the type Mila received), a sort of molecular eraser, which erases or fixes erroneous genetic messages. What the treatments have in common is that they can be programmed, in digital fashion and with digital speed, to correct or compensate for inherited diseases, letter for DNA letter.

How many stories like Mila‚Äôs are there? So far, just a handful.

But more are on the way. Where researchers would have once seen obstacles and said ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry,‚Äù they now see solutions in DNA and think maybe they can help.

The real challenge for ‚Äún-of-1‚Äù treatments (a reference to the number of people who get the drug) is that they defy just about every accepted notion of how pharmaceuticals should be developed, tested, and sold. Who will pay for these drugs when they help one person, but still take large teams to design and manufacture?

4/13/20, 20:31 - Vikas Business Phone: *Intellectual Speaks:FIAKS Community Experts on GDP LOSS in LOCKDOWN*

*View 1* CXO BANKER 
I think what this maths doesn't consider is the subsequent months, non essential ex shopping should bounce back items like clothing/ jewellery / travel HV only been pushed for later. *Covid-19, cash, and the future of payments*

_Key takeaways of report_
‚Ä¢ The Covid-19 pandemic has fanned public concerns that the coronavirus could be transmitted by cash.
‚Ä¢ Scientific evidence suggests that the probability of transmission via banknotes is low when compared with other frequently-touched objects, such as credit card terminals or PIN pads.
‚Ä¢ To bolster trust in cash, central banks are actively communicating, urging continued acceptance of cash and, in some instances, sterilising or quarantining banknotes. Some encourage contactless payments.
‚Ä¢ Looking ahead, developments could speed up the shift toward digital payments. This could open a divide in access to payments instruments, which could negatively impact unbanked and older consumers. The pandemic may amplify calls to defend the role of cash ‚Äì but also calls for central bank digital currencies.

4/17/20, 11:32 - Aditya Birla Piush Kothari Payment Bank NnR: *Key highlights from RBI press meet* 

RBI is monitoring the situation very closely and has been and *will continue to make changes as and when required*

_Key steps taken_

_A) to provode adequate liquidity in system_

‚úÖ Development of funds has been to large corporates and PSU entities, but impact has been more on small corporates. *Thus undertake TLTRO 2.0, for an INR500bn ( to begin with)* the funds will be invested in NBFCs with 50% to the mid sized, small sized NBFCs and MFI - this has to be done within 1 month of availmemt - this will be under HTM for banks 

‚úÖ refiance through NBARD, SIDBI and NHB - *to proved special refiance for INR500bn to enable them to meet sectoral credit needs ( NABARD - INR250bn, SIDBI - INR150bn and balance to INR100bn)* - additional requirement if any by them may be met by RBI. The advances will be charged at repo rate.

‚úÖ LAF , the bank is sitting on  higher liquidity ( on April 15th RBI absorbed INR6.9tn) , thus *reverse repo is further reduced to 25bps to 3.75%* other policy rates remains same

‚úÖ the WMA limit has been increased for states by 60% to plan there market borrowing program better over period of time. This will be available till September 2020. 

_B) To facilitate bank credit_

_regulatory measures to reduce financial stress_

‚úÖ asset classification- *90 day classification will exclude the moratorium period* . The bank will.have to *maintain additional 10% provisions on these standstill accounts over next 2 quarters* these provisions can later be adjusted against the provision requirement for slippage requirement. 

‚úÖ extention of resolution timeline- in case of large accounts under default an additional provision  of 20% required if not completed in 210 days, recognition the challenges   further 90dyas has been added for resolution

‚úÖ divided - *the SCB shall not make any dividend payout for FY20,- this will be reviewed in Q2Fy21*

‚úÖ for LCR - *it has been lowered to 80% from 100% from immediate effect* - this will be ramped up in phased manner 1st october 2020 90% and 100% by FY22 

‚úÖNBFC loans to CRE projects *extend 1 year moratorium without change in classification* - this will benefit both NBFC and real estate segment

_Other highlights_

‚úÖ Payment infrastructure is running efficiently/seamlessly, there is no downtime on internet banking etc. 

‚úÖ Forex reserves stands at USD476.8bn

‚úÖundertook 3 LTROs and one more will be done today of INR250bn 

First cut view- These are second such strong measures taken by RBi addressing most of the industry concerns especially on  NBFCs ( those were struggling with liquidity) also real estate segment.

*Impact of COVID-19 on Retirement Risks*

4/17/20, 12:16 - Vikas Business Phone: _FIAKS Report Aggregation Initiative (FRAI) 297_

*FICCI*
*_Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for Industry Post Lockdown_*

4/18/20, 19:02 - Vikas Business Phone: _FIAKS CSR vdo_ *10th Apple Effect*

One of the FIAKS Community Industry Evangelist who is a Founder of Fintech Company had his 50th birthday which is generally celebrated with Big Bang by all of us as it a major milestone. However, due to lock down it was not possible. So he did a simple calculation that even if 100 people would have attended his birthday it would mean an expense of Rs 5 Lakhs.

Looking at the bad situation of the migrants in the country, which shook him...  he decided to donate  *Rs 500,000* amount to feed the migrants in these camps. He wrote to all his friends including FIAKS to send him a gift in form of cash which has created another large kitty which is again getting donated to feed migrant worker. This is what we call *THOUGHT LEADERSHIP*

I am sure every one of you are doing something  to support the people in this time of crisis. Even if you decide forego one dinner party a month ie  Rs 2500/- per month. You are creating a large kitty of Rs 30,000 per annum which can be used for better purpose.  I am hoping this simple math makes some decisions appear so easy... *Isn‚Äôt it ?*

Here is another _FIAKS vdo_ *10th Apple Effect* which provides a great guidance to us. It helps us better understand appreciation for simple gift of life using *Law of Diminishing Gratitude* Let's stop taking things for granted.

Community Member says *Brent is not, it's only WTI.*


*FAB Query* what is BRENT

Brent refers to oil that is produced in the Brent oil fields and other sites in the North Sea. Brent Crude's price is the benchmark for African, European, and Middle Eastern crude oil. The pricing mechanism for Brent dictates the value of roughly two-thirds of the world's crude oil production.

*What is WTI*

West Texas intermediate (WTI), also known as Texas light sweet, is a grade of crude oil used as a benchmark in oil pricing. This grade is described as light crude oil because of its relatively low density, and sweet because of its low sulfur content.

*FAB query* what does Backwardation mean?

*Response*
Basically it is due to higher production and very low demand. At the same time cost of storage and carrying the oil is expected to be higher than price of oil for that time period. Until there is visibility of demand and opening of economies will be there, such pricing may become normal atleast for short term to compensate for higher production in last few months.

4/29/20, 10:30 - +91 90046 19987: Payment banks - A payments bank is like any other regular bank, but operating on a smaller scale and without involving any credit risk. It can carry out most banking 
operations but can‚Äôt advance loans or issue credit cards. It can, however, accept demand deposits (up to Rs 1 lakh), offer remittance services, mobile payments/transactions and other banking services like ATM and debit cards, net banking and third-party fund transfers (more like deposit-taking companies).

Neo-banks are fully digital entities without any physical network. What they offer- accounts credits payments and other such services. They usually don't have licences of their own but rely on bank partners to provide bank licensed services. So these are basically fintech firms that provide digital and mobile-first financial solutions. However, regulatory norms in India restrict such entities that are 100 percent digital.

4/30/20, 12:21 - Vikas Business Phone: *FIAKS Community thought leaders on stock sale by Aditya Puri before retirement report says*

*View 1*  Leadership team of  large PE/VC 

There are SEBI guidelines for disclosures on sale of shares by Promoters. Equity, by nature of risk for the investor, should not be over-regulated. The RBI wants Promoter holdings to drop over a period of time, which is contrary to the overall need for more capital. If the bank is well run, outside capital will also come in, diluting the promoter holding automatically

*View 2* Founder PE/VC

My basic difference on this is : No person is greater than the Institution. It is perception in our minds. Having said I must say that that all shareholders should have equal and similar rights to sell their shares. There are disclosures both on pledge and sale of shares by these people. A tight compliance of the process is important.

4/30/20, 18:11 - Fintech Aayush NnR: https://m.economictimes.com/news/company/corporate-trends/reliance-announces-pay-cuts-mukesh-ambani-forgoes-entire-compensation/articleshow/75469265.cms
4/30/20, 18:11 - Nearex Arun Tanksali CTO NnR: China operates as a country, while the rest of the world operates as individual/corporate interests. Even the US, which in many ways uses both carrots and sticks to bludgeon countries to support their economy and industries, is often just a bunch of interests that are not always aligned with the Govt. A recent example: I was on a call with the legal head in the airline industry and they were saying that several of their Chinese vendors had produced Force Majeure certificates issued by the Chinese Govt allowing them to invoke the FM clause in their contracts. No other country seems to be that organized behind its industry at that level of detail. 
When dealing with contracts (in an African context) of sufficiently large size, if it is a Chinese company bidding, then the remaining contenders are essentially bidding against the might of the Govt. They will bring the funding as needed and make sure contracts go to their companies.
Strangely enough, this is no different than what the US or the Europeans used to do in the past, except that right now they are looking inwards, particularly the US. Which leads them to lecture on morality and human rights :-)

4/30/20, 18:32 - Nearex Arun Tanksali CTO NnR: That's the Force Majeure clause, intended to be invoked when natural calamities, Acts of God and, most recently, pandemics prevent obligations under a contract from being met. This, depending on how the contract is worded, may do away with or at least reduce the liability of one  party to the other.

5/5/20, 13:02 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: *Intellectual Speaks:FIAKS Community Experts shared an extract of an interesting article on ANTI-AGING DRUGS*

The first wave of a new class of anti-aging drugs have begun human testing. These drugs won‚Äôt let you live longer (yet) but aim to treat specific ailments by slowing or reversing a fundamental process of aging.

The drugs are called senolytics‚Äîthey work by removing certain cells that accumulate as we age. Known as ‚Äúsenescent‚Äù cells, they can create low-level inflammation that suppresses normal mechanisms of cellular repair and creates a toxic environment for neighboring cells.

In June, San Francisco‚Äìbased Unity Biotechnology reported initial results in patients with mild to severe osteoarthritis of the knee. Results from a larger clinical trial are expected in the second half of 2020. The company is also developing similar drugs to treat age-related diseases of the eyes and lungs, among other conditions.

Senolytics are now in human tests, along with a number of other promising approaches  targeting the biological processes that lie at the root of aging and various diseases.

A company called Alkahest injects patients with components found in young people‚Äôs blood and says it hopes to halt cognitive and functional decline in patients suffering from mild to moderate Alzheimer‚Äôs disease. The company also has drugs for Parkinson‚Äôs and dementia in human testing. 

And in December, researchers at Drexel University College of Medicine even tried to see if a cream including the immune-suppressing drug rapamycin could slow aging   in human skin.

The tests reflect researchers‚Äô expanding efforts to learn if the many diseases associated with getting older‚Äîsuch as heart diseases, arthritis, cancer, and dementia‚Äîcan be hacked to delay their onset.

*View 11* Founder 
From Australia perspective , i do not know of any bank here offering esigning as such...it is still paper or fax based.

*Views 8*  CXO 
Most organisations have given laptops / desktops at home but have missed out on security.

Lots of work that was outsourced to Fintech/vendors, employs cheap labour like temporary workers/ interns. 

Huge gap between on paper permanent staff at Fintech and actual temporary staff employed which generally gets easily managed by Fintechs during Audits

Banks are vulnerable to hacks and data theft as web based access enabled to checker.

5/8/20, 18:01 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: *FINAL ANSWER TO FIAKS QUEST 74*

*The Most-Downloaded Apps in India during 8th and 14th April*


*No.1*
Aarogya Setu (5.5million)

*No.2*
Zoom (4.2 million)

*No.3*
Ludo King (3.8 million)

*Other apps that topped the charts:*

Carrom Pool (2.8 million)
Tiktok (2.6 million)
Google Pay (2.2 million)
UVideo (2.1 million)
Whatsapp (1.8 million)

*Aarogya Setu* app, developed by the Government of India has topped the charts despite several privacy concerns. The App is aimed at augmenting the initiatives of the Government of India, particularly the Department of Health, in proactively reaching out to and informing the users of the app regarding risks, best practices and relevant advisories pertaining to the containment of COVID-19. 

*Zoom's* reach in India grew in millions as more and more number of people started working from home. Webinars and online lectures have also contributed to the leaping growth of Zoom in India in spite of increasing fears of breaches in privacy and security.

Out of boredom, Indians also chose to download entertainment apps like Ludo King, Tiktok and Carrom Pool in large numbers!

*View 5* 

 Need to encourage local POS manufacturing or coin counting machine. Fake note detection machine etc 

*View 13* CXO e-commerce 

I feel the government has done a good job of expressing views for enabling made in India approach. But it doesn't mean government issue order and makes it compulsory. We are still part of the global economy and rest seller need to put effort in marketing this message and make its product globally competitive to think why Indians are not buying India product...they will find parameters like quality, price, sustainability etc and improving those parameters will only help the business to compete globally. Frankly, the message was to make local products compete globally and not banning/closing foreign products. Now the ball is in Indian manufacturer to let the customer decide if the quality is at par to global and obviously valued over and above the foreign competition.

*View 11* Co-Founder Fintech

There are two parts of the whole thing. One is intent and second is expertise. While sounds good about pushing such comtracts and other things local, how many of service provider or manufacturer in this space can vouch expertise? Without risk reward ratio being positive, core components of banking or transactional network will always be procured from established players.

Doesnt mean that they will be discouraged, but they have to demonstrate a very steep learning amd execution curve to reach there. Otherwise it will stay as jingoism for local players.

*Top 3 Contributors to WHO Fund*

*No.1*
The United States of Americaüá∫üá∏ (11.96%)

*No.2*
Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation (11.41%)

*No.3*
GAVI Alliance (6.49%)

*Contributors ranking 4th - 10th are as follows:*

4. UK üá¨üáß (5.86%)
5. Germanyüá©üá™  (5.51%)
6. European Commission (4.77%)
7. COVID-19 SPRPF (4.58%)
8. UNOCHA (4.25%)
9. JapanüáØüáµ (3.77%)
10. World Bank (3.39%)

It should be noted that these rankings and figures hold true only for Q1-2020.


The *United States of America* is the single-largest contributor to the WHO Fund, with a contribution of 553,008K as of Q1-2020. It is a permanent member of the Security Council of the United ations; and has played a vital role in the functioning of various organs of the UN, right from its conception. However last month, POTUS Donald Trump told his administration to temporarily halt funding to the WHO, the consequences of this instruction remain unclear.


The *Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation*, launched in 2000, is based in Seattle. From poverty to health, to education, their areas of focus offer the opportunity to dramatically improve the quality of life for billions of people. The Foundation builds partnerships that bring together resources, expertise, and vision‚Äîworking with the best organizations around the globe to identify issues, find answers, and drive change.


Created in 2000, *GAVI* is an international organisation - a global Vaccine Alliance, headquartered in Geneva, bringing together public and private sectors with the shared goal of creating equal access to new and underused vaccines for children living in the world‚Äôs poorest countries. Gavi now vaccinates almost half of the world‚Äôs children, giving it tremendous power to negotiate vaccines at prices that are affordable for the poorest countries and to remove the commercial risks that previously kept manufacturers from serving them. It is the 3rd largest financial contributor to WHO Funding.

_For more information, visit:_
https://open.who.int/2020-21/contributors/contributor

*FIAKS CLARIFICATION* 
We recognise your expertise in the subject and the credibility of the source you've mentioned. It is important that the *Quest listed Top 3 Contributors, not countries*. 

WHO receives funds as Assessed Contributions and Specified Voluntary Contributions. The Assessed Contribution is payable as a member of the organisation, and is determined by population and wealth of the concerned state. If those parameters are considered, U.S.A., China and Japan do lead as contributors.

However, the home page of the source site, under the sub-section 'How are we financed' under 'Financial Flow' logically lists Contributors by their 'Specified Voluntary Contributions' (SVC) as these are independent of any variables, and given solely by the discretion of the contributor.

U .S.A. alone made a SVC of 316,096K, the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation contributed 327,999K and the GAVI Alliance contributed 189,220K. Japan made a SVC of 95,106K and China made a contribution of 45,488K (according to the source site). 

We do not dispute the correctness of your claim; however, according to our rudimentary understanding, we considered the contributors by their 'Specified Voluntary Contribution' to WHO for the Quest.

Our source site, for immediate reference is linked below:
https://open.who.int/2020-21/contributors/contributor

*Top 3 Strongest Brands in the Insurance Sector*

*No.1*
Poste Italiane üáÆüáπ
(85.5)

*No. 2*
Ping Anüá®üá≥
(84.6)

Allianzüá©üá™
(83.5)

*Rankings from 4-10 are as follows:*

4. Old Mutualüáøüá¶ (82.8)
5. Aflacüá∫üá∏ (82.7)
6. Legal & General üá¨üáß (82.2)
7. MAPFREüá™üá∏ (81.3)
8. China Life üá®üá≥ (81.2)
9.Sun Life Financialüá®üá¶ (80.5)
10. LICüáÆüá≥ (80.4)

(Figures in the parenthesis indicate Brand Strength Index) 

*Brand Finance* published it's annual report on the most valuable and strongest insurance brands this month.  The relative strength of brands is calculated through a balanced scorecard of metrics evaluating marketing investment, stakeholder equity, and business performance. This is expressed in terms of the *Brand Strength Index (BSI) score*, out of 100 points.

The strongest brand in the market, *Poste Italiane*, successfully leveraged its strong territorial network of 12,000 post offices and highly developed digital services to reach its 35 million clients in Italy. It scored a BSI of 85.5 points, a solid boost of 4.8 points from last year. "In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, Poste has demonstrated its commitment to communities through a series of measures, from the introduction of pension withdrawals in alphabetical order to avoid overcrowded offices, working with the nation‚Äôs law enforcement to help the elderly withdraw their pensions, and assisting with mask distribution. These actions are a clear example of Poste Italiane‚Äôs investment to build its brand in line with its products ‚Äì improving consumers‚Äô perceptions of trust and reliability, and hopefully emerging from the crisis with a greater brand equity than before," states the report.

*Ping An* is a Chinese holding conglomerate whose subsidiaries mainly deal with insurance, banking, and financial services. Currently in the second place, it's BSI fell by 2.4 points this year. It has, however, retained its position as the *most valuable brand* in the insurance sector.

Founded in 2015, *Allianz SE*, is a German multinational financial services company headquartered in Munich. Its core businesses are insurance and asset management. The brand shot up by 14 places in the ranking and gain 4.4 BSI points in a year!  Allianz entities worldwide have mobilized resources and launched initiatives - small, big and everything in between ‚Äì to support communities in this difficult time.

Founder of the software firm Oracle,
the answer to today's quiz is:
*Larry Ellison*

Larry never graduated from college, but started off by building databases for the American Intelligence Agency CIA. He founded *Oracle* in 1977 and served as it's CEO until 2014. As of today, he serves as the Chairman of the Board as well as the Chief Technology Officer for the company. Aged 75, he is currently the 5th richest person in the world. 

In 2012, Ellison spent $300 million to buy nearly all of Hawaiian island Lanai. He plans on turning this island into a 'health utopia', a model for the entire world to learn from. For this, he launched the company *Sensei*, Japanese for 'master',  with Dr. David Agus. For the billionnaire, this 'Sensei' is data. Forbes published an  Exclusive in April that elaborated on his wellness plans for the island of Lanai.

6/5/20, 18:05 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: *FINAL ANSWER TO FIAKS QUEST 78*

The answer to today's quiz is:
*John Shepherd-Barron*

A British national who was *born in Shillong, India*, he is acclaimed to be the *inventor of the first ATM* in 1960, then known simply as a cash dispenser machine.

The story goes that John, who missed his bank's opening hours on the fateful day, was in the bath when he had a 'Eureka moment' and drew inspiration from a chocolate vending machine to build the world's first cash-vending machine. This booth dispensed cash in exchange of coupons, with a maximum withdrawal of 10 Euros! *Barclays* was the first bank to host this machine next to its branch in London. Although there's a chance that the story has been dramatized, it is known that there were several other engineers working in a similar direction. Their main aim was to incorporate the 'self-help' trend in the banking sector and automate the teller's job.

Today, ATMs have come a long way since the initial simple, gullible and varied design to a more sophisticated, secure and a globally uniform mechanism. Today's users access their accounts through a special type of plastic card that is encoded with user information on a magnetic strip. The strip contains an identification code that is transmitted to the bank‚Äôs central computer by modem. The users insert the card into ATMs to access the account and process their account transactions. 

_To know more about the intriguing history of ATMs, continue reading:_
https://www.smithsonianmag.com/history/atm-dead-long-live-atm-180953838/

6/9/20, 19:11 - Vikas Business Phone: <191> *FIAKS community Debates Tonight* _Why should it take so long to process a moratorium request?_

Here‚Äôs an experience with large Pvt sector  Bank that is  shared by the community member.

 _He says_ The link to apply for moratorium extension is shared by this  Bank on the evening of 5th with a statement that if the EMI for the month of June was deducted before the customer applied for extension of moratorium, the EMI amount will be refunded to the customer‚Äôs account subject to the customer having applied for the extension of moratorium in the same or the earlier month i.e. June. 

However, the Bank takes more than a week to refund. The Bank has enjoyed the float and has, in all probability, made money on the same as well for the entire duration of this delay. 

While the raise in tenure and interest is justified, *how is it justified that the bank parks this amount and uses the float, the customer loses the interest on the same and ends up paying more and longer*. 

*Why should it take so long to process a moratorium request?*

6/9/20, 20:18 - Vikas Business Phone: <191> *FIAKS community Debates Tonight* _Why should it take so long to process a moratorium request?_

*View 32* _CXO MNC banker_
 
A bankers view, to build a moratorium or a pause technology in the short term might have not been done, which means everything is being done manually, the system/ person that processed and approved the request and then forwarded it to whoever handles payments etc might take time if done manually, noone is thinking about the immediate hit that bank p&Ls are taking!!

Let's reverse this question, this person clearly had the funds in his account, and managed for a week, he would hv enjoyed the float right of the money that he technically owes to the bank?? I don't think ppl hav understood the spirit of moratarium. Sometimes it might be nice to appreciate the bankers view too!!

*View 12* _CXO/Founder FINTECH_ 
It‚Äôs a trick to get more float

*View 37* _CXO FINTECH FOUNDER_ 
In a way, it‚Äôs implied complicity. There is no pressure from regulator to be on right side of spirit. I have seen some lenders even sending mailers to customers who already applied for moratorium 1 to opt in again otherwise they will start deducting. That goes totally against what SC had guided banks and lenders for.

Anyhow it‚Äôs no incentive for customer besides managing cash flow to opt in. This way banks are actually trying to exploit the ones who are most affected (hence need moratorium) rather than supporting.

One counter view is also that banks want customer to pay and not opt in for moratorium so their liquidity and portfolio is maintained. Atleast some of affected customers will opt against going for moratorium once emi is debited.

6/10/20, 21:56 - Fintech Netpay Ajay Founder NnC: https://register.fca.org.uk/ShPo_FirmDetailsPage?id=0010X000049MfcjQAC
to compare a normal wallet license to that....

a) Services enabling cash placement on a payment account
b) Services enabling cash withdrawals from a payment account
c) Execution of payment transactions (not covered by a credit line)
d) Execution of payment transactions (covered by a credit line)
e) Issuing payment instruments or acquiring payment transactions
f) Money remittance
g) Execution of payment transactions via telecoms, IT system or network operator
h) Issuing Electronic Money

6/10/20, 22:27 - Fintech Netpay Ajay Founder NnC: 1.1.1. PAs are entities that facilitate e-commerce sites and merchants to accept various payment instruments from the customers for completion of their payment obligations without the need for merchants to create a separate payment integration system of their own. PAs facilitate merchants to connect with acquirers. In the process, they receive payments from customers, pool and transfer them on to the merchants after a time period.


4.1. PAs existing as on the date of this circular shall achieve a net-worth of ‚Çπ15 crore by March 31, 2021 and a net-worth of ‚Çπ25 crore by the end of third financial year, i.e., on or before March 31, 2023. The net-worth of ‚Çπ25 crore shall be maintained at all times thereafter.

6/11/20, 16:44 - Forum of Industry and Academic Knowledge Sharing: _FIAKS Bespoke_ *Do You Still Think Bankers Are Safe-Keeping Depositors Money?*

Looking at many banks and private institutions‚Äô failure or drove to moratorium shows the lack of proper audit and transparency by the authorities. Bank failure remains a major threat to consistent economic growth that leads to development. The impact caused by economic contraction prevalent during this phase originated due to several shocks resulting in liquidity preference increase among depositors who preferred holding more currency to demand deposits and other liabilities. While Government & RBI may not bail out all banks (where frauds happened), and it should not do as well, it also cannot leave those affected customers of such banks in a state, where they potentially lose their hard-earned money (that too after paying taxes on received interest as well), creating a situation, that makes them lose confidence in bank deposits. Can bank customers not expect that minimal responsibility from financial institutions (whose major expertise is loan underwriting, in addition to management of transaction lifecycle & payments)

6/11/20, 22:26 - Fintech Aayush NnR: Here is a very interesting real story: 
So a very good friend of mine is a lawyer in world‚Äôs second largest law firm, went to Stanford law, worked in a very large Indian law firm as well before that. While at Stanford, took a valuation class, taught by ex global MD of GS, where they were given an assignment to value Elon Musk and Tesla. (About a year / year and half back)

At the end of it the class figured that Tesla is not a car company, not a electronics company, not an AI company, not a battery company, so can‚Äôt be valued as such.

To which this famous professor quipped, since it is clearly none of them, hence it is beating all of them together in valuation.

At the end of his class, he said there are just max 6-7 widely enough accepted valuation methodologies, all of which are available online in pre-made excel sheets, so no real valuation can be made from them.

What matters is what you can make people think something is worth by doing enough signalling.
